page.title: 19Recent Events in Beckermet
page.content: The Mink Hunt on the River Ehen is an annual event.Mink are small brown animals which make their homes in river banks. They are not a native wild animal but were imported from America onto farms which bred them for their skins.Unfortunately some escaped and others were set free.They have now become a problem for the farmers because they kill lambs, ducks and hens.In May, the otter hounds come from Warwickshire, Worcestershire and Herefordshire to hunt our local rivers. In August 1984, the new road was opened. It was built to divert traffic for the Sellafield Atomic Energy Complex from the village of Beckermet. It has considerably reduced the amount of traffic using the village and it is a much safer place.
